thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's contract extension remains on offer despite Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's contract extension remains on offer despite Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger's contract extension remains on offer despite Bayern Munich defeat | Metro News
text:
Arsene Wenger’s contract extension remains on offer despite Bayern Munich defeat gossip Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 9:53 am Arsene Wenger is under pressure after a terrible result (Picture: Getty) 
The deal to extend Arsene Wenger’s reign at Arsenal remains on the table despite the 5-1 thrashing the Gunners suffered at the hands of Bayern Munich. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The humiliating defeat is the second time in as many seasons Arsenal have conceded five against Bayern and virtually ends all hope of the Gunners progressing into the next round of the Champions League. 
Calls for Wenger to be removed as manager have intensified since the result after what was already a difficult few weeks for the Frenchman after defeats to Watford and Chelsea. Arsenal fixtures 
Sutton – FA Cup (A) – weekend of 17/18 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr Wenger’s side conceded three goals in ten minutes in the second half (Picture: Getty) 
However, the BBC claim no decision will be made about Wenger’s future until the end of the season. 
It is also reported that any decision will be a mutual agreement between Wenger and the club who are unwilling to force their long-serving manager out the door. 
A host of pundits and former players have urged a change in command at the helm since the rout on Wednesday night. There is no chance Wenger will be leaving before the summer (Picture: Getty)
